info.title: The VICC Meta-Knowledgebase
info.description: A search interface for cancer variant interpretations assembled by aggregating and harmonizing across multiple cancer variant interpretation knowledgebases.

200.description: A response to a validly-formed query.

Allele.title: Allele
Allele.description: The sequence state at a Location.

CURIE.title: CURIE
CURIE.description:
A string that refers to an object uniquely.  The lifetime and scope of
an id is defined by the sender. VRS does not impose any constraints on
strings used as ids in messages. However, to maximize sharability of data,
VRS RECOMMENDS that implementations use [W3C Compact URI (CURIE)]
(https://www.w3.org/TR/curie/) syntax. String CURIEs are represented as
`prefix`:`reference` (W3C terminology), but often referred to as `
namespace`:`accession` or `namespace`:`local id` colloquially. VRS also
RECOMMENDS that `prefix` be defined in identifiers.org. The `reference`
component is an unconstrained string. A CURIE is a URI.  URIs may *locate*
objects (i.e., specify where to retrieve them) or *name* objects
conceptually.  VRS uses CURIEs primarily as a naming mechanism.
Implementations MAY provide CURIE resolution mechanisms for prefixes to
make these objects locatable. Using internal ids in public messages is
strongly discouraged.

ChromosomeLocation.title: ChromosomeLocation
ChromosomeLocation.description: A Location on a chromosome defined by a species and chromosome name.

CopyNumber.title: CopyNumber
CopyNumber.description:
The count of discrete copies of a Feature, Molecular Variation, or
other molecule within a genome.

CytobandInterval.title: CytobandInterval
CytobandInterval.description: A contiguous region specified by chromosomal bands features.

DefiniteRange.title: DefiniteRange
DefiniteRange.description: A bounded, inclusive range of numbers.

DerivedSequenceExpression.title: DerivedSequenceExpression
DerivedSequenceExpression.description:
An approximate expression of a sequence that is derived from a
referenced sequence location. Use of DerivedSequenceExpression indicates
that the derived sequence is approximately equivalent to the reference
indicated, and is typically used for describing large regions in contexts
where the precision of a literal sequence is unnecessary.

Expression.title: Expression
Expression.description:
The Expression class is designed to enable descriptions based on a
specified nomenclature or syntax for representing an object. Common
examples of expressions for the description of molecular variation include
the HGVS and ISCN nomenclatures.

Extension.title: Extension
Extension.description:
The Extension class provides VODs with a means to extend descriptions
with other attributes unique to a content provider. These extensions are
not expected to be natively understood under VRSATILE, but may be used
for pre-negotiated exchange of message attributes when needed.

Feature.title: Feature
Feature.description:
A named entity that can be mapped to a Location. Genes, protein domains,
exons, and chromosomes are some examples of common biological entities
that may be Features.

Gene.title: Gene
Gene.description:
A gene is an authoritative representation of one or more heritable
:ref:`Locations <Location>` that includes all sequence elements necessary
to perform a biological function. A gene may include regulatory,
transcribed, and/or other functional Locations.

GeneDescriptor.title: GeneDescriptor
GeneDescriptor.description: This descriptor is intended to reference VRS Gene value objects.

Haplotype.title: Haplotype
Haplotype.description: A set of non-overlapping Alleles that co-occur on the same molecule.

HumanCytoband.title: HumanCytoband
HumanCytoband.description:
A interval on a stained metaphase chromosome specified by cytobands.
CytobandIntervals include the regions described by the start and end
cytobands.

IndefiniteRange.title: IndefiniteRange
IndefiniteRange.description:
An indefinite range represented as a number and associated comparator.
The bound operator is interpreted as follows: `>=` are all values greater
than and including the value, `<=` are all numbers less than and including
the value.

LiteralSequenceExpression.title: LiteralSequenceExpression
LiteralSequenceExpression.description: An explicit expression of a Sequence.

Location.title: Location
Location.description: A contiguous segment of a biological sequence.

Matches.description: Statements and Propositions that match the queried parameters.

Method.title: Method
Method.description: Define model for methods used in evidence curation and classifications.

MolecularVariation.title: MolecularVariation
MolecularVariation.description: A variation on a contiguous molecule.

MoleculeContext.title: MoleculeContext
MoleculeContext.description: The structural variant type associated with this variant.

NestedStatementResponse.description: Define Statement Response for Search Endpoint.

example.description: Afatinib, an irreversible inhibitor of the ErbB family of tyrosine kinases has been approved in the US for the first-line treatment of patients with metastatic non-small-cell lung cancer (NSCLC) who have tumours with EGFR exon 19 deletions or exon 21 (L858R) substitution mutations as detected by a US FDA-approved test

variation_descriptor.label: L858R
variation_descriptor.description: EGFR L858R has long been recognized as a functionally significant mutation in cancer, and is one of the most prevalent single mutations in lung cancer. Best described in non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC), the mutation seems to confer sensitivity to first and second generation TKI's like gefitinib and neratinib. NSCLC patients with this mutation treated with TKI's show increased overall and progression-free survival, as compared to chemotherapy alone. Third generation TKI's are currently in clinical trials that specifically focus on mutant forms of EGFR, a few of which have shown efficacy in treating patients that failed to respond to earlier generation TKI therapies.

gene_context.label: EGFR
gene_context.description:
EGFR is widely recognized for its importance in cancer. Amplification and mutations have been shown to be driving events in many cancer types. Its role in non-small cell lung cancer, glioblastoma and basal-like breast cancers has spurred many research and drug development efforts. Tyrosine kinase inhibitors have shown efficacy in EGFR amplfied tumors, most notably gefitinib and erlotinib. Mutations in EGFR have been shown to confer resistance to these drugs, particularly the variant T790M, which has been functionally characterized as a resistance marker for both of these drugs. The later generation TKI's have seen some success in treating these resistant cases, and targeted sequencing of the EGFR locus has become a common practice in treatment of non-small cell lung cancer. 
Overproduction of ligands is another possible mechanism of activation of EGFR. ERBB ligands include EGF, TGF-a, AREG, EPG, BTC, HB-EGF, EPR and NRG1-4 (for detailed information please refer to the respective ligand section).

method.label: Standard operating procedure for curation and clinical interpretation of variants in cancer
method.authors: Danos, A.M., Krysiak, K., Barnell, E.K. et al.

Number.title: Number
Number.description: A simple number value as a VRS class.

RepeatedSequenceExpression.title: RepeatedSequenceExpression
RepeatedSequenceExpression.description:
An expression of a sequence comprised of a tandem repeating
subsequence.

SearchIDService.description: Define model for Search by ID Endpoint Response.

variation_descriptors.label: L858R
variation_descriptors.description: EGFR L858R has long been recognized as a functionally significant mutation in cancer, and is one of he most prevalent single mutations in lung cancer. Best described in non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC), the mutation seems to confer sensitivity to first and second generation TKI's like gefitinib and neratinib. NSCLC patients with this mutation treated with TKI's show increased overall and progression-free survival, as compared to chemotherapy alone. Third generation TKI's are currently in clinical trials that specifically focus on mutant forms of EGFR, a few of which have shown efficacy in treating patients that failed to respond to earlier generation TKI therapies.

gene_context.description:
EGFR is widely recognized for its importance in cancer. Amplification and mutations have been shown to be driving events in many cancer types. Its role in non-small cell lung cancer, glioblastoma and basal-like breast cancers has spurred many research and drug development efforts. Sequence.title: Sequence
Sequence.description:
A character string of residues that represents a biological sequence
using the conventional sequence order (5’-to-3’ for nucleic acid sequences,
and amino-to-carboxyl for amino acid sequences). IUPAC ambiguity codes
are permitted in Sequences.

SequenceExpression.title: SequenceExpression
SequenceExpression.description: One of a set of sequence representation syntaxes.

SequenceInterval.title: SequenceInterval
SequenceInterval.description:
A SequenceInterval represents a span of sequence. Positions are always
represented by contiguous spans using interbase coordinates.
SequenceInterval is intended to be compatible with that in Sequence
Ontology ([SO:0000001](http://www.sequenceontology.org/browser/
current_svn/term/SO:0000001)), with the exception that the GA4GH VRS
SequenceInterval may be zero-width. The SO definition is for an extent
greater than zero.

SequenceLocation.title: SequenceLocation
SequenceLocation.description: A Location defined by an interval on a referenced Sequence.

StatementResponse.description: Define Statement Response for Search Endpoint.

example.description: Afatinib, an irreversible inhibitor of the ErbB family of tyrosine kinases has been approved in the US for the first-line treatment of patients with metastatic non-small-cell lung cancer (NSCLC) who have tumours with EGFR exon 19 deletions or exon 21 (L858R) substitution mutations as detected by a US FDA-approved test

SystemicVariation.title: SystemicVariation
SystemicVariation.description:
A Variation of multiple molecules in the context of a system,
e.g. a genome, sample, or homologous chromosomes.

Text.title: Text
Text.description:
An textual representation of variation intended to capture variation
descriptions that cannot be parsed, but still treated as variation.

UtilityVariation.title: UtilityVariation
UtilityVariation.description:
A collection of :ref:`Variation` subclasses that cannot be constrained
to a specific class of biological variation, but are necessary for some
applications of VRS.

VCFRecord.title: VCFRecord
VCFRecord.description:
This data class is used when it is desirable to pass data as expected
from a VCF record.

ValueObjectDescriptor.title: ValueObjectDescriptor
ValueObjectDescriptor.description:
The root class of all VODs is the abstract Value Object Descriptor
class. All attributes of this parent class are inherited by child classes.

Variation.title: Variation
Variation.description: A representation of the state of one or more biomolecules.

VariationDescriptor.title: VariationDescriptor
VariationDescriptor.description:
This descriptor is intended as an class for describing VRS Variation
value objects.

VariationSet.title: VariationSet
VariationSet.description: An unconstrained set of Variation members.
